intro: Elionurus planifolius, commonly known as the flat-leaved elionurus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Elionurus planifolius thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas.
